newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN GOLD CLOSES HIGHER ON SEASONAL BUYING.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN GOLD CLOSES HIGHER ON SEASONAL BUYING.

text.p: ** Gold 24 carat closed 5 rupees higher at 4,470 rupees per 10 gramme as fresh seasonal buying dragged prices upward after an easy start.
** Prices of gold biscuits (116.64 gramme) closed 100 rupees higher at 52,300 rupees per piece after losing 200 rupees on Thursday.
** Silver (.999) closed 10 rupees higher at 6,320 rupees per kg but down 30 rupees against the opening level of 6,350 rupees on profit-taking by local stockists after a firm start.

Gold 24 carat closed 5 rupees higher at 4,470 rupees per 10 gramme against the previous close of 4,465 rupees and up 10 rupees against the opening level of 4,460 rupees per 10 gramme as fresh seasonal buying helped prices bounce back after an easy start, dealer said.
Gold was down 15 rupees per 10 grammes on Thursday. Reports of a recovery in the world market also dragged local prices upward near the close while supplies remained at a low ebb.
Prices of a gold biscuit (116.64 gramme) closed 100 rupees higher at 52,300 rupees per piece after losing 200 rupees on Thursday.
Premiums of import licences for bullion were steady during the day at 13.20/13.25 percent.

Silver (.999) closed 10 rupees higher at 6,320 rupees per kg against the previous close of 6,310 rupees but down 30 rupees against the opening prices of 6,350 rupees as unloading by local stockists trimmed early gains towards the close.

Silver was down by 15 rupees per kg on Thursday. Silver prices opened higher on the back of a rally in the world market but later on fresh arrivals of the imported metal cooled down market sentiments towards the close.
